How to Align and Extract a face from an image?

May 25, 2020

This is a very simple task in image processing. The alignment happens in two easy steps: first you computer the facial landmarks using your algorithm of choice. Then you take two points that should be parallel, such as the eyes’ outer corners, and rotate the image beta degrees, in order to align these points in the X axis (and the image as a whole).

beta = equation

In order to demonstrate it, I asked my friend Gabriel, If I could use he’s profile picture(he said yes, thanks Gabs).

Before Rotating After

You can check this and others implementation in my Computer Vision Toolkit repository.

How to Align and Extract a face from an image?


This is a very simple task in image processing. The alignment happens in two easy steps: first you computer the facial landmarks using your algorithm of choice. Then you take two points that should be parallel, such as the eyes’ outer corners, and rotate the image beta degrees, in order to align these points in the X axis (and the image as a whole).

beta = equation

In order to demonstrate it, I asked my friend Gabriel, If I could use he’s profile picture(he said yes, thanks Gabs).

Before Rotating After

You can check this and others implementation in my Computer Vision Toolkit repository.
